context: The moon is a mystery still. It is the biggest moon in the solar system compared to the size of the planet it orbits. About 1/3 the size of Earth I think. The orbit is in perfect sync with its rotation, making it so the same exact surface is always facing the Earth. The moon is perfect distance between the earth and the sun, as well as perfect size, to get a perfect eclipse of the sun. It is too perfect. And the gravitational pull on earth's waters create tides which provide necessary ecosystems for life. It is so perfect it defies the odds of impossibility.

replies.context: The moon is slowly receding away from the planet, the reason the same side always faces us is because of a concept called tidal locking, and there is nothing particularly extraordinary about a planet with a moon like ours considering there are billions of planets in our galaxy alone.
